title: GREAT APP!
text:
I have been selling clothes on this app for so many years! I started when I was in highschool, now I’m in my mid-20’s. This app doesn’t charge the seller outrageous fees, is easy to navigate through, and is perfect for anyone that’s a beginner at selling their clothes online. They make the instructions so clear and simple on how to post your clothes. The shipping guide is so nice and not confusing by any means. The messaging system is great too. I’ve tried so many other apps out there, but none of them compare to Vinted, honest truth. 

I love this app and recommend to anybody who wants to get their clothes out of the closet ASAP.

title: Such an amazing app!
text: I love this app so freaking much. I have a small business on Instagram and I wanted to start spreading my business on other platforms. I was told about this app and fell in love. They’re very protective of customers. If the seller don’t ship out they’ll refund your money 100%. They allow you to leave reviews, and so many features. There shipping prices are outstanding! They’re so freaking cheap. Small packages like a 9 by 6 is .99 cents and medium packages like a 10 by 13 is 2.99. They also have the option of bundles and so much more. 110% recommand this app. Tysm for whoever made Vinted!

title: No Seller Protection
text:
Please AVOID this app of you are a seller. You’re better off using other apps with seller protection from scammers.

I sold an item on Vinted to a buyer using the Vinted generated shipping label, after I shipped the item and it got delivered, the buyer claimed that she provided the wrong shipping address and Vinted cancelled the order and refunded the buyer.

The USPS tracking information shows the item as delivered, yet Vinted refunded the buyer and I just scammed out of a nice pair of boots.

When I tried to bring up the issue to Vinted support they said since the buyer claims to have not received the parcel they will not pay me for the item. 

Again the buyer provided the wrong address and I did nothing wrong as a seller, yet Vinted sided with the buyer. 

Vinted basically told me they can’t do anything about it and told me to contact USPS instead, but USPS delivered the item to the address that the BUYER provided as evidenced in the tracking and is not at fault. 

I’m shocked that in such a clear cut case of buyer error, Vinted will do nothing for the seller and refund the buyer. 

I’ve been a Vinted user for years, but this experience has made me rethink recommending this app to anyone. Please consider another app that doesn’t condone scamming loyal users.

title: High numbers of scammed attempts and awful support team
text: Today I joined this app for the first time and I tried to sell some stuff. I submitted some products and immediately one person texted me that she is interested to buy the item. Then I received an email from Vinted (or maybe somehow look like Vinted) and in the link there I got connected to the live chat and I got scammed for €300! I tried to contact the support team in the app and there was no answer! I’m still trying to recall back the money from my bank since the app wasn’t helpful at all! I will never ever ever try this app ever again in my life and I suggest you to not use it unless you wanna donate money to the thieves! This app is full of scammers and there is absolutely no customer service! If there is anyway, please shut this app down as it is not legitimate at all!!!!

title: What is going on?
text: I’ve run into a problem in the past month of sellers not shipping items out. I have contacted sellers to find out what’s going on, they read my message and they ignore it. The fact that I have to wait 5 or more days for Vinted to cancel orders on their end is wild. It states if you the buyer cancels too much you get negative feedback. That’s ridiculous!! I had 2 dresses I needed for events that are still pending. I do like this app because they have actual vintage stuff for cheap unless it’s the spillover depop girls selling overpriced thrift store finds. I hope they get better customer service and really develop the app. It’s a great place for cheap clothing and unique especially if you can’t find any in stores. Oh and there’s a TON of fake and scam listings on it now. Please be careful!!

title: Can’t verify my phone number
text:
Not sure why you actually need it in the first place… Tried to contact support, and they sent me a message, but guess what - I can’t see the message because I can’t get past the part where it asks me to verify my phone number. I AM TRYING TO GIVE YOU MONEY

Update: I already tried it on the site and not the app and it didn’t work there, either. However, it did work when I tried it the next day. 

Overall, the app still seems a little buggy. There are plenty of times when buttons or links won’t work, which makes me just want to use eBay or Poshmark. Seems like this app might still be a little newer, so maybe it’ll get better with time.

title: Do not recommend
text: If I could give this a zero star rating, I would. I use multiple resell platforms and this one is the most frustrating. It has become impossible to list items without those items getting removed or hidden for violating a platform rule. This would be fine if any rules were being broken, but every single time an item has been removed (over 20 times at this point), I have violated zero platform guidelines. I brought this up with their customer service chat line in the app and was offered very little advice, and did not get the 21 listings I had spent hours making restored, even though I broke no rules. As I said, it’s becoming nearly impossible to sell on this app. I suggest putting your time and energy elsewhere if you are wanting to resell and not waste it on this app.

title: Great app with a few issues
text: I’ve been buying and selling on Vinted for two years and it has been great until recently.  Just in the last month or two I keep being told not to ship out my items to buyers because they need to pass a security check but then I never hear anything back from Vinted? I have asked the buyers about this and they never have any idea what I’m talking about. Thankfully, I have shipped out their items anyways and it has been fine. The second problem I’ve been having is with generating shipping labels for my sales. This is becoming a huge issue and makes me look bad as a seller when there is a delay in shipping.  Please please please fix these problems!!

title: Avoid!
text:
Vinted seems to want to make sure that nobody actually sells anything on their app. They capriciously delete whole closets of legitimate sellers, tracking and payment for shipments often fails, leaving sellers empty handed and forcing the buyers to repeat the transaction. There are frequent ghostings of buyers that leave sellers in the lurch, and when a legitimate seller organized a sales event for other sellers to stimulate Vinted’s economy, the whole thing was deleted with absolutely no warning! Sure there’s no sellers fees but there is no service either. It’s all run by bots. Don’t even get me started on the lack of shop filtering and searchability!  It’s also overrun by scammers, low ballers, and abandoned closets, which if you buy from them and cancel because you realized too late that it’s inactive, YOU get the negative feedback!

I’m done on this platform!

title: Support needs to be quicker!
text: I’ve been selling in Vinted for 4 years! One thing I love NO SELLING FEES ❤️ however my issue is it’s takes forever to get to support. To many obstacles, having the contact support on the home page will be easier. Plus every time Vinted does an update, it messes up transactions, shipping labels and even catalogs! While support is nice & friendly the knowledge of issues is not all there at times. My entire catalog is not visible to me but it is to others. It’s been 20 hours and I’ve heard nothing since our last conversation.

title: No actual seller support
text: I’m an experienced online reseller, and Vinted is by far the worst site I’ve tried for reselling. They have absolutely no seller support: as in you can’t even contact them directly and receive a response. It clearly says after submitting feedback or requesting assistance that the comment will be reviewed but not responded to. I use the site occasionally for some “last chance” items that haven’t been moving elsewhere because if something goes wrong during the sale I'm not out too much, but I most definitely don’t attempt to sell high-interest items here. It’s too bad because initially I had hopes Vinted would be a great way to reach more buyers, but it definitely isn’t. Vinted is very much missing the mark when it comes to seller support and that ruins the selling experience.

title: Used to be my favorite app
text:
I used to LOVE this app! So much i recommend it to a TON of my friends. but was recently blocked and i still don’t understand why. I had three orders processing of items i was sooooo excited to receive and it says if your blocked you can still chat to get your orders to go through but nope !! they all got cancelled and I was SO disappointed! Not to mention it seems i’m permanently blocked with no reason why as
I am a buyer not even a seller! or some issue that I hope can be resolved. I really really hope that someone responds to my messages through help center and helps me get my account back because I really was rooting for this app and really want to get back.  I am scared that the response to this review with just be “reach out to us at the help center” and never actually get help.

title: RIPPED OFF!
text:
I thought I really liked this selling app. 
Besides all the scammers on here Vinted doesn’t do a very good job either! 
They give you a limited time to do things which OK but I recently sold a few items and the tracking took forever to update! 
I contacted the buyer and Vinted and I asked to not cancel just yet. They literally canceled it right after I sent that message and then the buyer received the items with Updated Tracking and Will Not respond to My Messages that is Clearly shown as ‘Read’ !  So I lost out on my Money and my items! 
Neither the buyer Nor Vinted is going to fix this…So it’s me losing out! Smfh.

title: Cant sell anything
text: I have tried this app for over several months now. I’ve had several people try to buy things from me. I can’t get a shipping label all it says is problem with shipping provider. If I contact support they say my info is wrong (which it is not) and to cancel order and reupload and have the person buy it again, still doesn’t work. I’ve lost so many sales because of this and I’ve looked online I’m not the only one having this problem.

title: Not for sellers
text: Could be nice as a buyer but NOT a seller. I was spam reported by someone just being malicious & my listings were deleted. The app said I used stock photos despite them all being my own photos and when I tried to contact support I was only met with a bot. I saw other people in the Vinted subreddit saying the same thing happened to them, they also had mall brand clothes (Forever 21, H&M, etc) being deleted for being fakes, and accounts permanently deleted without warning when they didn’t even know what they did. The app needs to realize that people maliciously report things ALL the time if they don’t agree with the price or if you have an online following. You can’t just delete something without a real person reviewing it first and not just a bot.

title: DO NOT DOWNLOAD
text:
Do not download this app! 
Vinted got an update where you can’t get past shipping or sell any of your items without your SOCIAL SECURITY! 
They said they’re doing it now to make sure we are a real person and not a bot.  They also ask for tax purposes and tax compliance for the IRS, for example, if you end up making more than $600 you’ll have to report it as income at the end of the year. A lot of people are really put off by it but apparently there’s no way to avoid it. It’s because there are new FTA regulations that went into effect in February of this year requiring sellers to give their SSN to prove identity for payment—all online platforms are subject to these regulations.
I say it is not worth selling on this app and there are plenty of other platforms you can sell on.

title: Beware!!
text: I have enjoyed this app until now. The tracking on one of my orders did not update on the platform but was marked as delivered on the post office website. Vinted cancelled my order without checking the tracking first so I lost my item and my earnings. The buyer is reading and not responding to my messages so I believe I was scammed. Vinted gave me a one star review for this order as it was not completed. I contacted customer support and they told me the only thing they can do is block the buyer until the buyer re-orders the item so I can receive my earnings. This extremely unfair and I am very disappointed. I have deleted my items and will be boycotting as well as spreading word about my experience. Please update your cancellation process. This could have been easily avoided!

title: Worst App Ever
text: Vinted requires your ENTIRE Social Security Number in order to sell. So I tried buying instead, but greatly regret it. They have support staff that are rude and don’t follow Vinted’s guidelines. I had a terrible experience with a support agent named Juan who straight up said that he thinks his opinion matters more than Vinted’s terms and that he can chose whether or not to enforce them. They allow sellers to leave revenge feedback for buyers, whenever buyers leave honest negative reviews. You can’t even give honest feedback to warn other buyers without having to be in fear of retaliation. They also require buyers to pay for return shipping, if they want to return an item that isn’t as described. It doesn’t matter if it’s the seller’s fault. Vinted thinks the buyer should be out money for the seller’s mistake.

title: Blocked my account right away
text:
I usually sell on poshmark, but I had heard about Vinted recently and their low seller fees so I decided to give it a shot. 
I started listing a few items and my account was blocked almost immediately saying I was selling unauthentic items and scamming people. I was not doing this and both items I listed were 100% real. I reached out to customer service and they have yet to reinstate my account. I have never had such a bad experience with a selling app so quickly. I am very dissatisfied with how this account is starting out so poorly. I would never list a fake item and if they can’t tell my items are real based on the photos of my quality items then there is something bigger wrong with this app.

title: Worst reselling app
text:
Few users, so few views and very few sales. The same items on mercari and Poshmark sell over 10x faster. I tried Vinted for a year and had low quality questions from buyers like asking if I could just sell the stone out of a $6 necklace. They’re so cheap. I purchased 2 shirts from someone, and they sent it in an actual black trash bag. Haha no!

The last straw was I sold an item and used their label, but it never picked up tracking. After contacting customer service, and marking the item as sent.. after 1 week, Vinted cancelled the order. The item is lost due to them cancelling, and their reps say to send them the receipt of shipment, which they know I don’t have bc I used their label. They’re stealing and offering a trash service. 100% unacceptable.

title: Zero stars if I had the option
text:
I’ve been selling in different platforms. At the beginning I thought it was an okay app but then I started having problems verifying my phone number, it kept saying “wrong phone number” or than some error happened on their end. Anyway, I tried different phone number a dozen of times and none of them work. Emailed the help support team and they kept replying back to my Vinted account which I couldn’t access due to not being able to verify my phone number. 
Save yourself the headache and annoyance from using this app, I already have sold items and have a balance which I lost since I can’t access my stupid account. My sanity worths more than the $ lost through this app.

title: Don’t waste your time
text: The app is very straightforward and simple, no complaints with how it runs. However, the average going price for everything is so incredibly low you might as well just give your stuff away to charity for free. For example, I sold a pair of Steve Madden heels (originally £100) that I only wore once and were in great condition. The buyer asked me to drop the price from £20 to £10. Other items I’m selling have been viewed and favorited a ton, but no one buys them. Selling brand new, never worn, tags on jeans originally £50 and no one will even buy them for £10. The clothes just take up space in our spare room and the whole process isn’t worth the wasted time and space.

title: Used to be great now its not
text: vinted used to be amazing it was infact my #1 selling app until shipping prices raised... i have over 70 five star reviews and as soon as shipping went up over $6 i barley had a sale its been months now since i have sold something! it is really frustrating and and in general not as easy to use like other selling apps, the layout really needs some work! currently they are down so i just hope the repairs they make are huge so we can get a while remodeling update so sellers have an easier time selling items :( will come back later to change this review once there are improvements made till then this is what i have to say.

title: Best selling app I’ve used so far
text: By far the best selling app I’ve used - there is NOT a sellers fee so whatever the item sells for is what you make, it is super easy to print shipping labels/ship out items, you can see how many people have viewed/favorited items, and things sell really fast. Within 48 hours of downloading the app and making an account I sold $40 worth of things which is double what I would make in a week on other selling platforms. 10/10 recommend.

title: Great except for one thing
text: This app has been great and it’s very easy to sell on here but I just wish that once you except someone’s offer,  the sale is automatically made. Having to wait for someone to provide payment after you except their offer is very annoying. I’ve had several instances where I’d accept someone’s offer only to be completely ghosted by them and then never get the sale. If you accept an offer, the sale should automatically be made. This is how Poshmark and mercari are ran and it’s so much better.

title: Used to be 5 stars…
text:
Vinted used to be my absolute favorite thrifting app. I told everyone about it. Then shipping went from .99 to 3.99 and that was challenging for both buying + selling and now at 6.92 it’s just frustrating! You can add at least $12 to every order just for shipping and fees. So a $2 item becomes almost $15.  
In addition there is little to no monitoring of spam or harassment. I can’t sell a bikini without tons of creeps messaging me and there is no liability or seller protection. 
I still love Vinted but am slowly stepping away from it as I don’t feel safe as a seller and honestly can’t even afford it anymore.

title: I shouldn’t have to sign up/in to try the app
text: I wanted to check this app out to see if I liked it, but every two seconds a signup page would appear and when I would click “skip” it would reset back to the Home Screen of the app, then immediately ask me to sign up again and again and again before I could even check anything out. Yeah hard pass from me, I don’t like signing up for stuff before checking it out only to be spammed infinitely from emails and notifications. Immediately uninstalled. Maybe chill on the signups and let ppl have the option to willingly signup instead of being forced into it. Maybe let ppl check out what they are signing up for, just a thought.

title: Amateur hour
text:
All the negative seller reviews are 100% correct. Weirdly amateur app. Punishes sellers for having photos look too professional (neutral or removed background). Despite claiming it’s because they want “proof” of ownership of item, customer support then ignores proof & simply doesn’t allow any photo on a white background. Policy is haphazardly enforced, too. I picked maybe 8 items from my 200+ inventory to test the app, and half were instantly deleted with no way to appeal — while the half left were using the same white background 🤷‍♀️

I don’t know why they’re so invested in seeing dirty carpets or messy beds, but I’ll be sticking to eBay, Depop, Posh & Mercari, where I’ve been selling for years without running into anything this level of stupid.

title: Disappointing
text: This app was great for the first month I had it but more and more people are having issues paying for items, most getting completely rejected from paying. Customer Service insists that it’s our fault and we have to use a different card (look at the multiple Reddit and Vinted threads about it) but it’s really because THEY haven’t updated their anti-fraud systems so banks won’t allow transactions. It’s so frustrating trying to spend your money over and over again and having customer service be actually RUDE about it when it’s THEIR fault AND getting 10p taken from your account every time it fails. They HAVE to fix their systems if they don’t want to keep losing business like this.

title: Wonderful Wonderful Seller
text: The seller was AMAZING!!! This package was delayed for almost 2 months because of the shipping method I chose. Regardless of the shipping issue, which is completely out of our hands, she consistently communicated with me and gave me many updates. She was so kind. The purchase finally arrived today and the 2months was well worth the wait. It is a super cute dress. Fits as mentioned and in great condition. I would highly recommend purchasing from this seller. She is incredibly reliable and honest.

title: Touchy & Aggravating
text: Don’t waste your time. I’ve been “selling” on this app (and many more) for years, but only make a sale once a month for like $2. Mercari, Depop, & Poshmark are much more consistent with sales traffic, plus all of their customer service representatives are so kind and thoughtful. Those are definitely apps with the Seller in mind. Vinted’s “Support” however- refuses to answer legitimate questions for help, their flagging system is super sensitive and they will not admit when they are wrong. Instead, they will insist that YOU are wrong and refuse to answer why. Half of the time you can’t even respond to Vinted Support’s messages- instead you have to jump through multiple hoops to try to contact a human.

title: Phenomenal seller!!!
text:
This girl was on top of this entire transaction every step of the way! Her description of the items was very detailed. She posted a lot of pictures that was very helpful in me making the decision to purchase all of these items.

Her communication skills were top-notch! I will definitely be looking out for more of her items. Super responsive to any questions I had in a very short period of time. This is a perfect example of a great seller! Thank you!

title: Calvin Klein Navy Velvet Dress-Amazing!
text: It looks just like the pictures but better on me. I love it! It was listed as a size 14 so when I got it and read the tag and it said Medium I was a little worried but it was a size 14 which is my normal size and I was very happy. It even has a built in bra! I love it! This is my first purchase ever on Vinted or from any online thrift store and I just want to say Thank you to the seller! It’s gorgeous! It looks brand new! Just in time for the holiday's!

title: New App is Worse
text: I liked Vinted because of cheaper shipping options and no fees taken out. But now ever since they switched to a new app, there are so many glitches. Also asks for social security number now in order to complete a sale. I got really mad when they kept removing a listing I made to advertise a sale in my closet. All I did was create a graphic and advertise that some of my items were on sale and I couldn’t get any help from their support team. They just kept saying it violated their catalogue of rules, when in fact there’s nothing listed in there saying it’s not allowed.

title: my buyers have dropped since shipping increased
text: as a seller this app has many problems as i’m sure other selling apps do. the shipping has gotten crazily expensive and i’ve noticed so much less buyers and i haven’t really bought much myself since the shipping has increased. sure there’s a reason shipping has gotten expensive but i just can’t justify spending a extra $10 on shipping and fees when the shirt i want is only $2. i appreciate the app doesn’t take fees and i hope this doesn’t change otherwise i will definitely move to another selling app since the no fees is the only reason i stick with vinted. i just hope the shipping price will eventually drop to what it used to be. when i joined vinted shipping was only $3 now the lowest shipping is reaching $7. i get super lowball offers which i didn’t before the shipping increase but honestly i understand the low balls, if i don’t even want to pay $10 in shipping in fees i don’t expect many of my followers to either.

title: Amazing variety of clothes, but horrible app
text: When I tell you I can’t buy anything on here I’m serious. I’ve had this app for 1-2 weeks and have found lots of good deals. MULTIPLE TIMES I have tried to buy bundles or single items. They won’t take my card, which is a Mastercard, that you people have stated you accept. It pisses me off how many times I contacted support and they tell we to wait and they’re sorry and they’re still investigating my “case”. I have double checked my card numbers, made sure I have the funds in my account, and made sure my card wasn’t disabled. It’s ridiculous cause I bought 3 SEPARATE things today with my card but this app refuses to work with it.

title: Unsupportive to buyers… preference to scammers
text:
Downloaded the app on reference from a friend and made a purchased. After almost two months, I never received the item. 

Countless of messages to both the seller and Vinted customer service were ultimately futile. 

Untimely the seller never shipped the item and stopped responding to messages. Later on re-listed the item I purchase.

I flagged this to Vinted customer service who instructed me to wait 10 additional business days (on top of the 1 month I had already waited), to see if the item would turn up. In that time, Vinted marked the transaction as completed and released my funds to the seller. 

Countless of raised concerns and messages to customer service resulted in Vinted saying I was out of luck and there was nothing they could do. 

Even though the history of unresponsive messages was there from the seller and clear evidence that they re-listed the same item which they never shipped to me but got paid for. 

This was a clear disdain for the customer and in support of obvious scammers on the app.

title: Cannot contact anyone with questions
text:
Updated: The best part of the developer’s response is that they send you a link to their “help” section with the same information and no way to contact them. Hilarious. Apple - take note. They aren’t complying. 

Photos on white backgrounds do not automatically equal stock photos - you need to improve your AI and actually provide a way to communicate with your “team.”

Thankfully there are many credible selling sites. This one is a waste of time.

Original review: I had a listing pulled allegedly because it was a copyrighted photo. Except I 100% took the photo myself. I’d like to find out how you are supposed to sell something that is new in its box without photographing the box (I’m open to suggestions), but there is literally no way to contact anyone. I had hoped that the improvements everyone mentioned were going to make it a useful site, but the combination of a policy that makes it impossible to post a toy if it’s in its box and the inability to make an inquiry make it impractical at best.

title: Poor UX and lack of customer support
text: The app is weirdly separated per country. The UX is poor and buggy. A listing i posted was flagged for supposedly using images pulled from the internet instead of my own, when in actuality you could literally see me on the photo. There were no options to contest the deletion and all my info for that posting was deleted automatically. It's impossible to find a customer support email or form. When i did find a form by googling for it, customer service told me they only supported Canada. They gave me link to forms for other countries, and the US one was a broken form resulting in another dead end.

title: So many fake sellers and scams
text:
There are so many fake sellers on here it is hard to search for bags. Juicy Couture bags - most of the listings are from fake sellers / scammers you can tell by their names and if they don’t accept payment

Solution: make sellers upload a photo of their ID (2-3 forms) ; make funds unavailable until buyer approves the item and hold the buyers funds until then. 

Deleting this app for now; I was able to buy one shirt on here that came in the mail from a seller with good reviews. There are too many fake listings to sift through. If a buyer doesn’t have great reviews and their user name is a bunch of numbers or gibberish; don’t buy.

title: SSN
text: I downloaded the app, super excited to get started. I spend hours uploading everything and putting all the information in. I finally got an offer, and accepted it. Just then did the app ask me for my SSN, I am an international so I do not have one. I talked to costumer service and they explained why I needed one, which was great but I kept asking them what I should do with the offer I had already accepted. They kept sending the same message several times, without answering my message. I like that they answered me quickly, but I would appreciate an actual answer. Also, I would recommend saying something about the required information BEFORE someone spends hours on the app.

title: Being investigated by the EU AVOID!
text:
Guys and gals I cannot stress this enough.  Avoid this app.  I’m so embarrassed I downloaded it and had friends download it.  I sold 5 or 6 things and bam i wake up this morning for fraud 🤣. You cannot even get a dime of your money until the item is shipped and delivered then 2 days if everything’s okay!  Stay with mercari.  Pay the fees.  Atleast they take care of business. I should have known with No seller fees.  

A simple google search about this company tells you all you need to know.  You can seat vinted blocked on Facebook search as well.  

I have a pending balance of $49 on my account they never sent me a shipping label in email and I cannot access chats to print them.  

I literally joined yesterday and posted clothes and had 5 or 6 sales and it said pending progress under where they bought.  Never got the shipping labels but packed up waiting for them.  

Love the apps platform and the fact they have a forum
To chat with others.  But literally everyone is being banned left and right!

title: ACCOUNT SUSPENDED AND NO WAY TO RECEIVE MY EARNED MONEY
text: BEWARE: Vinted had my account suspended March 24th for suspicious activity. I had assumed someone who is not me had tried to access my account, and they suspended it so said person could not buy anything with my information. Fine. But it has since been 48 hours with no email from Vinted back, with me proving ownership that I own that account. They still sent automated emails that my packages have been delivered though.  I have no idea if I will get access back to my account or my own money, especially because so many people have had issues with Vinted not responding to their emails or complaints. BEWARE WHAT YOU SELL YOU MAY NEVER GET YOUR MONEY FOR! Try any other app.

title: Ads are far too big.
text: I don’t mind ads being on the app at all, but I’ve only had the app a few days and have accidentally opened the ads well over 10 times. They’re far too big, and you’re constantly accidentally clicking them when scrolling through the app. It’s extremely obnoxious, and makes me close the app only a few minutes after opening it every time because I can’t stand the ads constantly opening.

title: Scummy Business Practices
text: I have been a member of Vinted and used the app for YEARS. Yesterday was the first time I switched over to the new app, and all of a sudden my account is flagged for suspicious activity. I did nothing different than I ever have! Not only that, but there is no way to contact the customer service team to get this cleared up. They don’t have a phone number or an email to contact, and their “help” section on the app won’t even let me send them a message due to my account being blocked. For no reason. What am I supposed to do?? So now I’m out a pretty good deal of money with absolutely no way to contact them to get my account back. Absolutely scummy.

title: Don’t sell here unless you want no pay/no item
text: I have sold on here for the past year and I keep the receipts from every time I drop packages off at the post office but apparently that didn’t matter as they cancelled the order after it did not track like it should’ve done and I submitted the receipt as my only proof that I shipped the item. If I stay with this app I guess I will take a selfie with the mail lady/man I give the package to as I have no idea what counts as prof of shipment if the receipt doesn’t. Find another app to sell your items, unless you want to just give them away but I would recommend NUW if you are wanting to do that, much nicer ppl!

title: cheap items being way more than expected

title: App doesn’t work, terrible costumer service
text: There’s a bunch of nice clothes for surprisingly cheap, but it’s pointless when the app doesn’t work. I signed up for Vinted a few weeks ago and have added a payment method to my account as well as confirmed my email, but the ‘Buy Now’ button won’t work. Every time I press it, it takes me to a chat with the seller no matter who I’m trying to buy from. I’ve attempted to talk to costumer service but they replied to my email with a bot and a link that just takes me to the FAQ, so I have no way of notifying anyone about this. I’m writing this review in hopes to finally get some answers as I’d love to use this app.
